abstracts.cdata!:
Project objectives were satisfactorily
            achieved, with the exception of those relating to enhancing
            institutional capacity, which were only partially achieved.
            The project's impact on quality of education and the
            relevance of the training programs could not be fully
            appraised due to the lack of indicators to evaluate these
            important dimensions. The overall assessment of the project
            design is unsatisfactory; the project suffered from being
            too ambitious, and lacked adequate instruments to provide
            monitoring and evaluation of project impact. Implementation
            processes, quality targets, and long-term sustainability
            concerns received insufficient attention. The project
            components did not include measures or indicators to assess
            actual impact or quality of implemented activities. Project
            sustainability is uncertain. Having provided good support to
            the project during preparation, implementation, and
            follow-up, the overall rating for Bank performance is
            satisfactory. Similarly, overall Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Lessons learned stressed the synergies between
            access to education and quality concerns, the importance of
            monitoring and evaluation in developing teacher training and
            professional programs, and support for teacher training,
            securing financial sustainability, improving donor
            coordination, preserving equity, and private sector development.
